dos: Drink water regularly; start your day with a glass.
Move your body: target 7–10k steps if appropriate for you.
Practice good hygiene: wash hands regularly.
Take breaks from screens every 20-30 minutes.
Spend time outdoors for fresh air and natural light.
Practice stress management techniques like deep breathing.
donts: Limit sugary drinks and ultra-processed snacks.
Don't rely on supplements without professional advice.
Avoid excessive screen time before bed.
Don't ignore persistent symptoms or health concerns.
Avoid smoking and limit alcohol consumption.
Don't compare your health journey to others.
Avoid sitting for long periods without movement.
diet_tips: Build a balanced plate: 1/2 veggies, 1/4 protein, 1/4 whole grains.
Prioritize lean proteins (fish, beans, tofu, chicken).
Choose high-fiber carbs (oats, brown rice, quinoa).
Healthy fats in moderation (nuts, olive oil, avocado).
Stay hydrated: aim for 8 glasses of water daily.
Practice portion control: use smaller plates.
Eat mindfully: chew slowly and avoid distractions.
Plan meals ahead to make healthier choices.
hydration: Start your day with a glass of water.
Carry a water bottle with you throughout the day.
Add fruits like lemon or cucumber to water for flavor.
Monitor urine color as a hydration indicator.
Drink water before, during, and after exercise.
Replace sugary drinks with water or herbal tea.
exercise: Find activities you enjoy to make exercise sustainable.
Start with small, achievable goals (10-15 minutes daily).
Include both cardio and strength training in your routine.
Take the stairs instead of elevators when possible.
Walk or bike for short errands instead of driving.
Try bodyweight exercises that require no equipment.
